thread.title: Who won at the People's Choice Awards 2017? Ellen DeGeneres makes history and Johnny Depp delivers emotional speech
thread.title_full: Who won at the People's Choice Awards 2017? Ellen DeGeneres makes history and Johnny Depp delivers emotional speech

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Who won at the People's Choice Awards 2017? Ellen DeGeneres makes history and Johnny Depp delivers emotional speech
text:
Who won at the People's Choice Awards 2017? Ellen DeGeneres makes history and Johnny Depp delivers emotional speech All the highlights from the star-studded 43rd annual bash Share All the big winners from the 2017 People's Choice Awards (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
American TV favourite Ellen DeGeneres made history as she picked up three gongs at the 2017 People’s Choice Awards on Wenesday night. 
The 58-year-old triumphed in the Favourite Daytime TV Host, Favourite Comedic Collaboration and Favourite Animated Movie Voice categories at the ceremony, which was held at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. 
Justin Timberlake was on hand to present the awards to Ellen, before being joined on stage by 20 well dressed men holding each of Ellen's People’s Choice Awards. Comedienne Ellen DeGeneres, winner of a record-setting 20 career People's Choice Awards (Photo: WireImage) Comedian Ellen DeGeneres accepts an award onstage (Photo: FilmMagic, Inc) 
He said: "Tonight her People’s Choice Awards total hits 20! I don’t know how that’s possible! Let’s bring them all out ... Ladies and gentlemen, winning tonight for Favourite Daytime TV Host, Favourite Comedic Collaboration, Favourite Animated Movie Voice, she’s the most decorated winner in People’s Choice history. She is one of my very good friends; I love her very much. 
"She’s one of the best people on this planet and no one is more deserving. The one and only Ellen DeGeneres." Actress Blake Lively (Photo: WireImage) Actor Tom Hanks accepts Favorite Dramatic Movie Actor (Photo: Getty Images North America) Actress Jada Pinkett Smith (Photo: FilmMagic, Inc) 
And when Ellen - whose movie Finding Dory also took home the Favourite Movie and Favourite Family Movie gongs - took to the stage, her acceptance speech was littered with jokes about mashed potatoes and animals. 
She told the crowd: "Wow, thank you very very much and Justin, you are very underdressed. You know I was driving here tonight on the 101, filled with people; I got here like seconds before it started and I was thinking, I love mashed potatoes. Don’t you love mashed potatoes? I should have them more often, especially when they’re creamy and have no lumps in them. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
